DOC.detailed_description: Lateral epicondylitis tennis elbow often-encountered disorder elbow characterize tenderness pain lateral epicondylitis humerus grip weakness . The annual incidence lateral epicondylitis report % 1-3 general population . Lateral epicondylitis commonly associate repetitive overuse wrist , activity include strong grip turn cause microtears degenerative change common origin wrist finger extensor lateral epicondyle . New research show underlying mechanism degenerative rather inflammatory . It propose cause pain may mechanical discontinuity collagen fiber biochemical irritation result damage tendon tissue activate nociceptors . It suggest eccentric load show assist tendon rehabilitation improve collagen alignment stimulate collagen cross-linkage formation , improve tensile strength . Kinesio tap ( KT ) new application adhesive taping design Kenzo Kase avoid unwanted effect conventional tap restrict range motion ( ROM ) limit functional activity . The recommended tape application method outline 'Clinical Therapeutic Applications Kinesio Taping Method ' 8 . Elastic therapeutic tape design allow longitudinal stretch 140 % rest length design approximate elastic quality human skin . In particular , application tape stretch muscle create convolution skin hypothesize reduce pressure mechanoreceptors dermis , thereby decrease nociceptive stimulus . Another mechanism claim proponent tape convolution raise ridge tape skin think decompress underlying structure allow enhanced circulation increase subcutaneous space . In last year , use KT become increasingly popular rehabilitation program adjunct treatment . However , scientific evidence effect insufficient . The aim study compare effect kinesiology tap exercise , sham tap exercise exercise alone lateral epicondylitis .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Having symptom less 12 week 2 . Tenderness pain lateral epicondylitis 3 . Provocation lateral elbow pain least one follow test resist middle finger extension ( Maudley 's test ) , resist wrist extension passive stretch wrist extensor ( Mill 's test ) . 1 . Cervical spondylosis radiculopathy 2 . Diabetes mellitus 3 . Neuropathy 4 . Arthritis upper extremity 5 . History injection physical therapy lateral epicondylitis within last three month 6 .
